<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Notes">Notes</span></h2>
<style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1011085734">.mw-parser-output .reflist{font-size:90%;margin-bottom:0.5em;list-style-type:decimal}.mw-parser-output .reflist .references{font-size:100%;margin-bottom:0;list-style-type:inherit}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns-2{column-width:30em}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns-3{column-width:25em}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns{margin-top:0.3em}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns ol{margin-top:0}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns li{page-break-inside:avoid;break-inside:avoid-column}.mw-parser-output .reflist-upper-alpha{list-style-type:upper-alpha}.mw-parser-output .reflist-upper-roman{list-style-type:upper-roman}.mw-parser-output .reflist-lower-alpha{list-style-type:lower-alpha}.mw-parser-output .reflist-lower-greek{list-style-type:lower-greek}.mw-parser-output .reflist-lower-roman{list-style-type:lower-roman}</style><div class="reflist reflist-lower-alpha">
<div class="mw-references-wrap"><ol class="references">
<li id="cite_note-1"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-1">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Where governor's office is located.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-8"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-8">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="/wiki/Names_of_Istanbul" title="Names of Istanbul">formerly known as Constantinople</a></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-11"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-11">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Istanbul straddles both Europe and Asia, with its commercial and historical centre and two-thirds of the population in Europe, the rest in Asia. Since Istanbul is a transcontinental city, <a href="/wiki/Moscow" title="Moscow">Moscow</a> is the largest city entirely within Europe.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-byz-date-42"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-byz-date_42-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The foundation of Byzantion (<a href="/wiki/Byzantium" title="Byzantium">Byzantium</a>) is sometimes, especially in encyclopedic or other tertiary sources, placed firmly in 667 BCE. Historians have disputed the precise year the city was founded. Commonly cited is the work of 5th-century-BCE historian <a href="/wiki/Herodotus" title="Herodotus">Herodotus</a>, which says the city was founded seventeen years after <a href="/wiki/Chalcedon" title="Chalcedon">Chalcedon</a>,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-37"><a href="#cite_note-37">[34]</a></sup> which came into existence around 685 BCE. <a href="/wiki/Eusebius" title="Eusebius">Eusebius</a> concurs with 685 BCE as the year Chalcedon was founded, but places Byzantion's establishment in 659 BCE.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEIsaac1986199_38-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEIsaac1986199-38">[35]</a></sup> Among more modern historians, Carl Roebuck proposed the 640s BCE<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-39"><a href="#cite_note-39">[36]</a></sup> and others have suggested even later. The foundation date of Chalcedon is itself subject to some debate; while many sources place it in 685 BC,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTELister197935_40-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTELister197935-40">[37]</a></sup> others put it in 675 BCE<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEFreely199610_41-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEFreely199610-41">[38]</a></sup> or even 639 BCE (with Byzantion's establishment placed in 619 BCE).<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEIsaac1986199_38-1"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEIsaac1986199-38">[35]</a></sup> Some sources refer to Byzantium's foundation as the 7th century BCE.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-pop-figures-64"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-pop-figures_64-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-pop-figures_64-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">Historians disagreeâsometimes substantiallyâon population figures of Istanbul (Constantinople), and other world cities, prior to the 20th century. A follow-up to Chandler &amp; Fox 1974,<a href="#CITEREFChandler1987">Chandler 1987</a>, pp.Â 463â505<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-chfo_79-1"><a href="#cite_note-chfo-79">[73]</a></sup> examines different sources' estimates and chooses the most likely based on historical conditions; it is the source of most population figures between 100 and 1914. The ranges of values between 500 and 1000 are due to <a href="#CITEREFMorris2010">Morris 2010</a>, which also does a comprehensive analysis of sources, including Chandler (1987); Morris notes that many of Chandler's estimates during that time seem too large for the city's size, and presents smaller estimates. Chandler disagrees with <a href="#CITEREFTuran2010">Turan 2010</a> on the population of the city in the mid-1920s (with the former suggesting 817,000 in 1925), but Turan, p. 224, is used as the source of population figures between 1924 and 2005. Turan's figures, as well as the 2010 figure,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-turkstat-curr_185-0"><a href="#cite_note-turkstat-curr-185">[179]</a></sup> come from the Turkish Statistical Institute. The drastic increase in population between 1980 and 1985 is largely due to an enlargement of the city's limits (see the <a href="#Administration">Administration section</a>). Explanations for population changes in pre-Republic times can be inferred from the <a href="#History">History section</a>.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-Stamboul-72"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Stamboul_72-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">In the Ottoman period the inner core of the city, inside the city walls, came to be known as "Ä°stanbul" in Turkish and "Stamboul" in the West. The whole city was generally known as Constantinople or under other names. See <a href="/wiki/Names_of_Istanbul" title="Names of Istanbul">Names of Istanbul</a> for further information.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Edhemp286_71-0"><a href="#cite_note-Edhemp286-71">[66]</a></sup></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-195"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-195">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Based on state register data, which is unchangeable and inhereted from the family. A married women is also registered to her husband's province.</span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-uefa-category-281"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-uefa-category_281-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">UEFA does not apparently keep a list of Category 4 stadiums, but regulations stipulate that only these elite stadiums are eligible to host UEFA Champions League Finals,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-278"><a href="#cite_note-278">[271]</a></sup> which AtatÃ¼rk Olympic Stadium did in 2005, and UEFA Europa League (formerly UEFA Cup) Finals,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-279"><a href="#cite_note-279">[272]</a></sup> which ÅÃ¼krÃ¼ SaracoÄlu Stadium did in 2009. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/T%C3%BCrk_Telekom_Arena" title="TÃ¼rk Telekom Arena">TÃ¼rk Telekom Arena</a> is noted as an elite UEFA stadium by its architects.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-280"><a href="#cite_note-280">[273]</a></sup></span>
</li>
</ol></div></div>

<li id="cite_note-106"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-106">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20160304025758/http://e-dergi.marmara.edu.tr/marucog/article/view/1012000723/1012000620/" rel="nofollow">"Comparisons of Annual Meanprecipations of Annual Meanprecipitation Gridded and Station Data: An Example from Istanbul, Turkey YÄ±llÄ±k Ortalama GridlenmiÅ YaÄÄ±Å Verisi ve Ä°stasyon YaÄÄ±Å Verisinin KarÅÄ±laÅtÄ±rÄ±lmasÄ±, Ä°stanbul ÃrneÄi â USTAOÄLU â Marmara CoÄrafya Dergisi"</a>. <i>marmara.edu.tr</i>. <li id="cite_note-168"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-168">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1 cs1-prop-foreign-lang-source"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20150401055615/http://www.tbmm.gov.tr/kanunlar/k5216.html" rel="nofollow">"BÃ¼yÃ¼kÅehir Belediyesi Kanunu"</a> [Metropolitan Municipal Law]. <i>TÃ¼rkiye BÃ¼yÃ¼k Millet Meclisi</i> (in Turkish). 10 July 2004. Archived from <a class="external text" href="http://www.tbmm.gov.tr/kanunlar/k5216.html" rel="nofollow">the original</a> on 1 April 2015<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">30 November</span> 2010</span>. <q>Bu Kanunun yÃ¼rÃ¼rlÃ¼Äe girdiÄi tarihte; bÃ¼yÃ¼kÅehir belediye sÄ±nÄ±rlarÄ±, Ä°stanbul ve Kocaeli ilinde, il mÃ¼lkÃ® sÄ±nÄ±rÄ±dÄ±r. (On the date this law goes in effect, the metropolitan city boundaries, in the provinces of Ä°stanbul and Kocaeli, are those of the province.)</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=T%C3%BCrkiye+B%C3%BCy%C3%BCk+Millet+Meclisi&amp;rft.atitle=B%C3%BCy%C3%BCk%C5%9Fehir+Belediyesi+Kanunu&amp;rft.date=2004-07-10&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.tbmm.gov.tr%2Fkanunlar%2Fk5216.html&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AIstanbul"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-339"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-339">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1 cs1-prop-foreign-lang-source"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20120815003309/http://www.istanbul-ulasim.com.tr/yolcu-hizmetleri/a%C4%9F-haritalar%C4%B1.aspx" rel="nofollow">"AÄ HaritalarÄ±"</a> [Network Maps] (in Turkish). Ä°stanbul UlaÅÄ±m A.Å. (Istanbul Transport Corporation). <div class="navbox-styles nomobile"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1061467846" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/></div><div aria-labelledby="Istanbul_in_Istanbul_Province_of_Turkey" class="navbox" role="navigation" style="padding:3px"><table class="nowraplinks hlist mw-collapsible mw-collapsed navbox-inner" style="border-spacing:0;background:transparent;color:inherit"><tbody><tr><th class="navbox-title" colspan="3" scope="col"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1063604349" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist navbar-mini"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:Districts_of_Turkey" title="Template:Districts of Turkey"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="View this template">v</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a href="/wiki/Template_talk:Districts_of_Turkey" title="Template talk:Districts of Turkey"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Discuss this template">t</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:Districts_of_Turkey&amp;action=edit"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Edit this template">e</abbr></a></li></ul></div><div id="Istanbul_in_Istanbul_Province_of_Turkey" style="font-size:114%;margin:0 4em">Istanbul in <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Istanbul_Province" title="Istanbul Province">Istanbul Province</a> of <a href="/wiki/Turkey" title="Turkey">Turkey</a></div></th></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="width:1%">Districts</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-odd" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">

<div class="navbox-styles nomobile"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1061467846" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/></div><div aria-labelledby="European_Capitals_of_Sport" class="navbox" role="navigation" style="padding:3px"><table class="nowraplinks mw-collapsible autocollapse navbox-inner" style="border-spacing:0;background:transparent;color:inherit"><tbody><tr><th class="navbox-title" colspan="2" scope="col"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1063604349" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist navbar-mini"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:European_Capital_of_Sport" title="Template:European Capital of Sport"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="View this template">v</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a class="new" href="/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:European_Capital_of_Sport&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" title="Template talk:European Capital of Sport (page does not exist)"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Discuss this template">t</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:European_Capital_of_Sport&amp;action=edit"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Edit this template">e</abbr></a></li></ul></div><div id="European_Capitals_of_Sport" style="font-size:114%;margin:0 4em">European Capitals of Sport</div></th></tr><tr><td class="navbox-list navbox-odd hlist" colspan="2" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">
<ul><li>2001 <a href="/wiki/Madrid" title="Madrid">Madrid</a></li>
<li>2002 <a href="/wiki/Stockholm" title="Stockholm">Stockholm</a></li>
<li>2003 <a href="/wiki/Glasgow" title="Glasgow">Glasgow</a></li>
